unnormalised: Okay, so I've been meaning to get into yoga for ages. My doctor, Dr. Sharma, has been recommending it for my back pain (sitting at my desk coding all day is killing me!). Everyone's always raving about how amazing it is for stress relief and overall wellness. But honestly, the sheer number of yoga practices out there is overwhelming!
normalised: Okay, so I have been meaning to get into yoga for ages. My doctor, Doctor Sharma, has been recommending it for my back pain (sitting at my desk coding all day is killing me exclamation mark). Everyone is always raving about how amazing it is for stress relief and overall wellness. But honestly, the sheer number of yoga practices out there is overwhelming exclamation mark

unnormalised: Like, is Hatha yoga the same as Vinyasa? What‚Äôs the deal with Ashtanga ‚Äì is that super intense? My friend Priya goes to a Bikram class, which sounds like you're basically exercising in a sauna! (Is that even healthy?!) And then there's restorative yoga, which sounds nice and relaxing but also... not like *real* exercise?

unnormalised: I'm also a little self-conscious. I'm definitely not the most flexible person (think rusty gate, not graceful swan!). And I live in a small apartment ‚Äì maybe only 600 sq ft! ‚Äì so I'm not sure I have enough space to do all these elaborate poses I see online.

unnormalised: Anyone have any advice for a total newbie like me? Are there any good beginner-friendly studios in Bangalore? Or maybe some online resources that are good for learning the basics? Any insights would be greatly appreciated! I need to ditch these late-night chai binges and cultivate some inner shanti! Thinking of shelling out Rs. 2000 for a trial class, is it worth it? Let me know your thoughts!
